paragraphs.content: Chapter 13
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 13

paragraphs.content: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

paragraphs.content: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.

paragraphs.content: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

paragraphs.content: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

paragraphs.content: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

paragraphs.content: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

paragraphs.content: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.

paragraphs.content: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.

paragraphs.content: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

paragraphs.content: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

paragraphs.content: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

paragraphs.content: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.

paragraphs.content: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

paragraphs.content: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

paragraphs.content: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.

paragraphs.content: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.

paragraphs.content: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

paragraphs.content: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

paragraphs.content: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.

paragraphs.content: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

paragraphs.content: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.

paragraphs.content: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

paragraphs.content: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.

paragraphs.content: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

paragraphs.content: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
